column1: '''Ringarë''' was the last month of the year according to the [[Kings' Reckoning
column2: Kings']] and [[Stewards' Reckoning]] of [[Gondor]], and the ninth month according to the [[New Reckoning]]. Ringarë in the Kings' and Stewards' Reckoning corresponded to [[Foreyule]] in the [[Shire Calendar]] (approximately modern [[21 November]] through [[20 December]]). The [[Sindarin]] name was [[Girithron]].<ref>{{App

column1: The word obviously contains the word ''ringa'' "cold". [[David Salo]] notes that the ending might be also seen in the abstract nouns ''almare'' "blessedness" and ''fanyare'' "the skies". Therefore the meaning of ''Ringare'' is equivalent to "*coldness".<ref>{{webcite
